title: Canadian Stocks Rise After Rate Decisions
text:
By Micah Maidenberg

The S&P/TSX Composite Index rose 83 points, or 0.5%, on Wednesday, closing at 16501. The blue-chip S&P/TSX Index gained 6 points, or 0.6%, closing at 989.

The Bank of Canada said earlier Wednesday it would leave its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 1.75%.

The move was expected and shares for Canadian stocks increased. Meanwhile, in the U.S., the Federal Reserve cut its federal-funds rate by a quarter-percentage point.

Shares of the Royal Bank of Canada (RY.T) rose 0.4%, while Bank of Montreal (BMO.T) gained 0.7%. Canadian National Railway Co. (CNR.T) shares increased 1.3%, while Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd. (CP.T) rose 1.7%. Barrick Gold Corp. (ABX.T) shares gained 2.1%.

Write to Micah Maidenberg at micah.maidenberg@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 30, 2019 17:43 ET (21:43 GMT)
